Title: The role of stress during memory reactivation on intrusive memories
Author: Cheung, Jessica; Garber, Benjamin; Bryant, Richard A.
ExperimentalCondition: Socially evaluated cold pressor test (SECPT) + reactivation
Step1_ExperimentalCondition: Cold water stress induction + trauma reminder
Step2_Individual_technique: Cold water stress induction + trauma reminder vs. Cold water stress induction
ResultSummary: Stress/Reactivation condition had significantly more intrusive memories than the Stress condition
Level2_detailed: Cold water stress induction + trauma reminder vs. Cold water stress induction

Journal: Journal Of Behavior Therapy And Experimental Psychiatry
Title: How does immediate recall of a stressful event affect psychological response to it?
Author: Gittins, Catherine B.; Paterson, Helen M.; Sharpe, Louise
ResultSummary: SAI participants had significantly higher IES-Intrusion scores than controls
Notes_fromMo: This article is also a 2*2 design, while there is no interactive effects, should we just report the significant main effect? If so, should we also ask for non-significant main effect？

Journal: Journal Of Behavior Therapy And Experimental Psychiatry
Title: How does immediate recall of a stressful event affect psychological response to it?
Author: Gittins, Catherine B.; Paterson, Helen M.; Sharpe, Louise
ResultSummary: No group difference on IES-R intrusion subscale between SAI and control group
Notes_fromMo: This article is also a 2*2 design, while there is no interactive effects, should we just report the significant main effect? If so, should we also ask for non-significant main effect？; Stats provided by the author via email

Journal: Journal Of Behavior Therapy And Experimental Psychiatry
Title: Unconscious thought reduces intrusion development: a replication and extension
Author: Krans, Julie; Janecko, Dorte; Bos, Maarten W.
ExperimentalCondition: Conscious thought condition (trauma recall + memory test expectation)
ComparisonCondition: Unconscious thought condition (2-back working memory task + memory test expectation)
ResultSummary: UT group showed lower intrusion score than CT group

Title: Vantage perspective in analogue trauma memories: an experimental study
Author: Mooren, Nora; Krans, Julie; Naring, Gerard; van Minnen, Agnes
TraumaInductionStimuli: Eyewitness report of real-life road traffic accidents
ResultSummary: Field perspective had higher score on IES intrusion subscale than observer perspective
Notes_fromSZ: This paper, the intrusion includes both visual intrusions and visual+verbal intrusion. But the analysis only focused on the total (i.e., (only visual) + (visual+verbal combination)). In this case should we code them seprately?

Title: Vantage perspective in analogue trauma memories: an experimental study
Author: Mooren, Nora; Krans, Julie; Naring, Gerard; van Minnen, Agnes
TraumaInductionStimuli: Eyewitness report of real-life road traffic accidents
ResultSummary: field perspective condition score higher on IES-intrusion than the control perspective
Notes_fromSZ: This paper, the intrusion includes both visual intrusions and visual+verbal intrusion. But the analysis only focused on the total (i.e., (only visual) + (visual+verbal combination)). In this case should we code them seprately?

Title: Arresting visuospatial stimulation is insufficient to disrupt analogue traumatic intrusions
Author: Meyer, Thomas; Brewin, Chris R.; King, John A.; Nijmeijer, Desiree; Woud, Marcella L.; Becker, Eni S.
Step1_ExperimentalCondition: Trauma reminder + high visual stimulation imagery
ResultSummary: No group difference on IES intrusion between H-VA+imagery+reminder and no-task control group

Title: The effect of dissociation at encoding on intrusive memories for a stressful film
Author: Brewin, CR; Saunders, J
